Education

May 2020

Brown University, PhD in Physics. (GPA 4.0)
Thesis: Dark Matter Searches in the Crescendo of the 21st Century Experiments
Advisor: JiJi Fan

May 2014

Chinese University of Hong Kong, MPhil in Physics. (GPA 3.6)
Thesis: Topics in Cosmic Ray Measurement and Particle Detectors Development
Advisor: Ming Chung Chu

May 2012

Chinese University of Hong Kong, BSc in Physics, minor in French. (GPA 3.6)
Thesis: Rabi Oscillation and State Construction in Quantum Bouncing Ball System
Advisor: Chi Kwong Law

Professional Experience

Aug 2014 – May 2020

Brown University
Conducted particle phenomenology research on 100 million samples of astrophysics data with Bayesian and Markov-chain Monte-Carlo methods using SQL and Python. Simulated and analyzed a billion samples of particle physics data of a size of several TBs using C++.

Aug 2012 – May 2014

Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory
Developed a data acquisition firmware for a field programmable gate array to process sensing microchips data at a time-scale of 10 nanoseconds, using VHDL and Verilog as firmware languages.

Aug 2010 – May 2014

Chinese University of Hong Kong
Constructed a muon telescope by programming hardware control using C. Coded a back-end C++ program for data cleaning and signal detection on time series data of the muon telescope’s pixels.

Aug 2011 – May 2012

Chinese University of Hong Kong
Investigated quantum bouncing ball and demonstrated construction of arbitrary quantum states with Rabi oscillations. Simulated the system using Mathematica.

May 2011 – Aug 2011

European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN)
Became the one of the first two students representing Hong Kong to participate in research in CERN. Mechanically and electronically assembled of CMS Cathode Strip Chambers in ME4/2 site. Project report is available HERE.
